subject: Ethics
title: Privacy by Design Principles
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Privacy by Design Principles.

hook.text: What if apps were built to collect the least data possible, not the most? That's privacy by design.

buildup.text: Ann Cavoukian proposed seven principles: be proactive, make privacy the default, embed it into design.

discovery.text: Instead of adding privacy after building a product, you architect the system around data minimization from day one.

twist.text: Apple adopted this: processing face data on your phone, not their servers. Privacy became a selling point.

climax.text: Privacy by design proves that protection and innovation aren't enemies. You just have to build them together.

punchline.text: The best privacy feature is never collecting the data at all.

quiz.question: What is the core idea of privacy by design?
options: Add privacy settings after product launch
Build systems to minimize data collection from the start
Let users choose their own privacy level later
